main_definition: A wide, tree-lined street or avenue in an urban area, typically with multiple lanes and often featuring pedestrian walkways.

meanings_and_examples.example: The Champs-Élysées is one of the most famous boulevards in Paris.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A broad, tree-lined avenue that may be used for parades and celebrations
meanings_and_examples.example: During New Year's Day Parade, the streets were transformed into vibrant boulevards filled with revelers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal term to refer to someone who spends a lot of time in bars or other social venues
meanings_and_examples.example: Don't forget your friend who likes to be called 'the Boulevard', he's out with his friends at the local pub.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used in some countries to refer to a large, fast-food restaurant chain
meanings_and_examples.example: I met my friend for lunch at the McDonald's on the Boulevard across from work.
